questionTitle: He was an ________ writer because he persuaded many people to see the trust of his idea.
I ________ seeing John tomorrow so I will give him your message.
The temperature yesterday was about ________ for the time of year.
John swims very well and ________ does his brother.
The old lady was very ________ for our help.
________ it was raining heavily he went out without a raincoat.
Your progress will be ________ in six months' time.
I don't know why he complains about his low salary all the time. He doesn't earn as ________ as I do.
The company has had a bad year, and will therefore not be ________ any new workers.
He's a wonderful cook: he can make a delicious ________ out of almost anything.
From now on everything will be ________ sailing, I hope. No more problems.
He could hardly ________ such a generous offer.
He had made his money by developing a profitable travel ________.
Do you believe ________ all that nonsense?
I'm not sure ________ the exact date, but I think he arrived here in 1959.
She may pride herself on her abilities, but she's not capable ________ bringing up children.
He was born ________.
Although they have travelled extensively, they have never been ________.
At this hour the street was ________ as everyone was fast asleep in bed.
All ________ artists must struggle with the conflict between ________ their own talent and knowledge that very few are great enough to succeed.
